sections.title: Keep More of Your Returns
sections.subtitle: Structure your portfolio to minimize taxes without sacrificing growth

sections.title: Workshop Focus
items: Leverage tax-loss harvesting and capital gains planning

sections.title: Tax Drag Explained
sections.content: Taxes reduce net returns through dividends, interest, and realized capital gains. Strategic account selection and trade timing can improve after-tax performance, especially for long-term investors.

points.title: Tax-Advantaged First
points.description: Maximize contributions to 401(k)s, IRAs, HSAs before taxable accounts when possible.

points.title: Asset Location
points.description: Hold tax-inefficient assets (bonds, REITs) in tax-deferred accounts; place tax-efficient equities in taxable accounts.

points.title: Capital Gains Timing
points.description: Favor long-term holdings to benefit from lower tax rates and defer gains.

sections.title: Tax Alpha
sections.content: Incremental improvements in after-tax returns compound significantly over decades.

sections.title: Tax-Loss Harvesting Basics
sections.content: Selling investments at a loss to offset gains can reduce current taxable income. Reinvest proceeds in a similar, not identical, asset to maintain market exposure and avoid wash-sale rules.

sections.title: Tax Optimization Plan
steps: List all investment accounts (taxable, traditional, Roth) and note current balances.
Assign each holding to an account based on tax efficiencyâ€”plan any transfers or rebalancing needed.
Review the past year's realized gains/losses and identify opportunities for tax-loss harvesting.
Set calendar reminders for quarterly tax check-ins to avoid surprises at year-end.
Document your tax-aware investing rules in your investment policy statement.

sections.title: Use Tax Software Integrations
sections.content: Tools like TurboTax import brokerage data to highlight opportunities for harvesting and capital gains planning.
